adrFormatAddress: 451 10th Ave, New York, NY 10018-1106, USA

originalText.text:
Another upscale restaurant for dinner in Hudson yard. It‚Äôs a prefect place for a date night that‚Äôs not in the heart of Hudson yard not too crowded. The high ceiling and big window makes the space so airy.

The food is prefect for share or enjoy individually. The grill head-on shrimp is jumbo and so flavorful. The scallops are perfectly seared and taste sweet. The pork chop is well marinated and good portion. Food are good but didn‚Äôt wow me. The price for this ambience and service, it‚Äôs reasonable in Hudson yard area.

The menu isn‚Äôt big , but I do expect to have seasonal menu so I can come back to try something different

originalText.text: Tuna and Grilled Shrimp are the only dish that we actually liked! Other main course was super salty to the point that after few bites you just don‚Äôt want to eat it anymore. Presentation was on point, food was fresh but they need to work on the Salt haha half chicken was super juicy and flavorful but super salty. Two fish that we ordered was like eating salt. Cocktails were really good. I would go back just for drinks maybe.

originalText.text:
Had an amazing pre-theater dinner at Greywind! üåü The Daisy cocktail üç∏ is a must-try... super refreshing if you are into Tequilla!

All the dishes were next level. Who knew carrot hummus could be so delicious? ü•ï

Shoutout to Ceasar for the top-notch service and making us feel like VIPs ‚ù§Ô∏è.

Thanks, Greywind, for an experience worth repeating many times again... especially with  the rotating, local, farm fresh creations. Great concept for the neighborhood.

originalText.text: Nice room from Dan Kluger (Loring Place) on a formerly desolate stretch of 10th Avenue, now Hudson Yards/Lincoln Tunnel adjacent. Eclectic menu, fish, burger, pork. Interesting starters. We had the cornbread and butter lettuce salad with Asian pear to start. Cornbread was a bit dense and dry and weird but I kinda liked it. Heavy though, probably better for a party of 4. The butter lettuce salad was delicious. My burger was very good but not sure I‚Äôd recommend it at $31, overpriced. Also, potato chips on top with French fries on the side is a bit of overkill. I knocked most of the chips to the side. The pork chop was very good. I had a classic Negroni, well made ($20) and my husband had an alcohol free Negroni ($15!). Guys you might want to bring that price down, it‚Äôs not a finely crafted cocktail. We were too full for dessert. Service was professional, efficient and friendly.

The butter lettuce salad was delicious. My burger was very good but not sure I‚Äôd recommend it at $31, overpriced. Also, potato chips on top with French fries on the side is a bit of overkill. I knocked most of the chips to the side. The pork chop was very good. I had a classic Negroni, well made ($20) and my husband had an alcohol free Negroni ($15!). Guys you might want to bring that price down, it‚Äôs not a finely crafted cocktail. We were too full for dessert. Service was professional, efficient and friendly.

originalText.text: Such a great experience!! Sat by the bar and had Ishmael as a server/bartender. The best! Had cheese-its and scallops and the nectarine upside down cake. He made great recommendations and was friendly but not intrusive. Quite attentive. Looking forward to going again.
